Granger was born in [[Portsmouth]], [[England]]. She took a Modern Languages degree at the [[University of London]], taught [[English language|English]] for a year in [[France]], but eventually went to work in the [[Visa (document)|visa]] sections of British [[Consul (representative)|consulate]]s and [[embassy|embassies]] in [[Yugoslavia]], [[Czechoslovakia]] and [[Austria]]. She married a work colleague in the foreign service and went with him to [[Zambia]] and [[Germany]] before returning to live in England with their two children. Her first novels were [[historical fiction|historical]] [[romance novel|romance]]s published under the ''nom de plume'' '''Ann Hulme'''. After her return to England, her first [[crime fiction|crime novel]], ''Say It With Poison'', was published in [[1991 in literature|1991]]. ==Bibliography== ===Historical romances (selection)===
